problems.title: Fixing: Not Suctioning on Pet Hair Eraser
problems.description: Comprehensive guide to resolving not suctioning issues. If your Pet Hair Eraser is acting up, followed these steps.
solution_steps: Turn off and unplug the device.
Inspect the  for visible damage or debris.
Clean all contact points using a dry cloth.
Reset the machine by holding the power button for 10 seconds.
If the issue persists, replace the .

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a Pet Hair Eraser?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $301 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Pet Hair Eraser needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my Pet Hair Eraser myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
